Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Add build hook to AccountDeleter and GitHubVulnerabilities2Db" (#7973) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Closed issue "[Package Renames] Unblock deployments to existing search instances" (#7977) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
We will be running two search instances side-by-side:

* `011` - The existing search service used to serve production traffic, without popularity transfers
* `012` - The new search service used to A/B test popularity transfers

Deployments to the exising search service will be blocked by the following:
1. [NuGet.Services.Metadata#774](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Services.Metadata/pull/774/files) requires the popularity transfer auxiliary file to exist. Merging this will block deployments to `auxiliary2azuresearch` and the search service.
1. Updating the `011` instance of `auxiliary2azuresearch` will apply popularity transfers to production traffic.

We should be able to deploy the latest bits to both of these instances:

* [x] Add a configuration to disable popularity transfers on a specific search instance
* [x] Add the popularity transfers auxiliary file to all existing search deployments
  * [x] DEV
  * [x] INT
  * [x] PROD
* [x] Validate all jobs and services work on the existing `011` instance
  * [x] `auxiliary2azuresearch`
  * [x] `catalog2azuresearch`
  * [x] Search service

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[2020-05-11] Deployment" (#7981) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### CopyAzureContainer

**Note:** this job is not shut down during deployment and therefore can fail. Before deploying to the environment, remote into the machine and stop the process before deploying.

Changes:
- Config only: stop backing up reg4

Environments:
- [ ] DEV
- [ ] INT
- [ ] PROD

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[C2R] Rewrite Catalog2Registration to better handle mega package pushes" (#7734) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
The current implementation has problems with package IDs with many versions. It is hard to fix the current implementation due to the complexity added by DotNetRdf. The new implementation will be vanilla C# and Newtonsoft.Json.

## Results

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/94054/81096053-b6ca6480-8eba-11ea-9026-0ced7fabd04f.png)


variant | p99 | p95 | p90 | p50
-- | -- | -- | -- | --
reg4 | 79.062 | 69.091 | 27.972 | 4.578
reg5 | 11.628 | 6.482 | 5.287 | 3.715
delta | -67.434 | -62.609 | -22.685 | -0.863

We need to revert and keep using 9.0.1 until further notice.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Index out of bounds [Mono 5.18.0.240] [NuGet 5.5.1.6542]" (#9541) at NuGet/Home

with `package.config`
```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<packages>
  <package id="Newtonsoft.Json" version="12.0.3" targetFramework="net35" />
</packages>
```

System.IndexOutOfRangeException: Index was outside the bounds of the array.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "`dotnet add package -s sourcename` doesn't work. `-s sourceurl` does." (#9511) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
_From @varunmankal on Friday, May 1, 2020 10:25:30 PM_

I have added my private source to NuGet.config file. when I run `dotnet nuget list source` it displays the following sources:
* nuget.org
* myprivate

Now, If I want to install a package from myprivate source then I try to run the following command:
`dotnet add package <packageName> -s myprivate`
then it returns an error saying the source `myprivate` not found.
If I run the same command using the myprivate URL instead of source name then it works.

How can I use source name instead of URL in the above command.

**Target framework**

- [3.1.2 ] .NET Core


---
#### Document Details

⚠ *Do not edit this section. It is required for docs.microsoft.com ➟ GitHub issue linking.*

* ID: ff30b638-44e3-077c-3cad-b61d1314c303
* Version Independent ID: 784413e1-77f5-f2e6-a8f4-56a73fe2d3bf
* Content: [dotnet add package command - .NET Core CLI](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/core/tools/dotnet-add-package#options)
* Content Source: [docs/core/tools/dotnet-add-package.md](https://github.com/dotnet/docs/blob/master/docs/core/tools/dotnet-add-package.md)
* Product: **dotnet-core**
* Technology: **dotnet-cli**
* GitHub Login: @tdykstra
* Microsoft Alias: **tdykstra**


_Copied from original issue: dotnet/docs#18216_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Error about unknown tools version "Current" during update" (#9506) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about problem

Using NuGet.exe 5.5.1.6542 on a PC with Visual Studio 2019 and Visual Studio Build Tools 2019 (2) installed on a German Windows 10 64-bit PC.

## Detailed repro steps 

Having the following command line call:

``` cmd
"c:\P\KM\_Build\NuGet.exe" Update "c:\P\KM\BaseLibrary\Source\BaseLibrary\BaseLibrary.csproj"
```

First brings this output:

> MSBuild auto-detection: using msbuild version '16.5.0.12403' from 'C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2019\BuildTools\MSBuild\Current\bin'.

Then, it runs fine on one PC and brings the following (German) error on another PC:

> Die Toolsversion "Current" ist unbekannt. Verfügbare Toolversionen sind "2.0", "3.5", "4.0".  c:\P\KM\BaseLibrary\Source\BaseLibrary\BaseLibrary.csproj

Translated manually to English, this reads:

> The tools version "Current" ist unknown. Available tool versions are "2.0", "3.5", "4.0".  c:\P\KM\BaseLibrary\Source\BaseLibrary\BaseLibrary.csproj

The CSPROJ that generates the error is a .NET Framework 4.7.2 class library that builds successfully in Visual Studio 2019 on both PCs.

### Verbose log

The verbose log looks like this:

```cmd
C:\P\KM\_Build>"c:\P\KM\_Build\NuGet.exe" Update "c:\P\KM\BaseLibrary\Source\BaseLibrary\BaseLibrary.csproj" -verbosity detailed
NuGet Version: 5.5.1.6542
MSBuild auto-detection: using msbuild version '16.5.0.12403' from 'C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2019\BuildTools\MSBuild\Current\bin'. Use option -MSBuildVersion to force nuget to use a specific version of MSBuild.
Die Toolsversion "Current" ist unbekannt. Verfügbare Toolversionen sind "2.0", "3.5", "4.0".  c:\P\KM\BaseLibrary\Source\BaseLibrary\BaseLibrary.csproj
Microsoft.Build.Exceptions.InvalidProjectFileException: Die Toolsversion "Current" ist unbekannt. Verfügbare Toolversionen sind "2.0", "3.5", "4.0".  c:\P\KM\BaseLibrary\Source\BaseLibrary\BaseLibrary.csproj
   bei Microsoft.Build.Shared.ProjectErrorUtilities.ThrowInvalidProject(String errorSubCategoryResourceName, IElementLocation elementLocation, String resourceName, Object[] args)
   bei Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.Project.Data.InitializeForEvaluation(IToolsetProvider toolsetProvider, IFileSystem fileSystem)
   bei Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.Evaluator`4..ctor(IEvaluatorData`4 data, ProjectRootElement projectRootElement, ProjectLoadSettings loadSettings, Int32 maxNodeCount, PropertyDictionary`1 environmentProperties, IItemFactory`2 itemFactory, IToolsetProvider toolsetProvider, ProjectRootElementCacheBase projectRootElementCache, ISdkResolverService sdkResolverService, Int32 submissionId, EvaluationContext evaluationContext, Boolean profileEvaluation, Boolean interactive)
   bei Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.Evaluator`4.Evaluate(IEvaluatorData`4 data, ProjectRootElement root, ProjectLoadSettings loadSettings, Int32 maxNodeCount, PropertyDictionary`1 environmentProperties, ILoggingService loggingService, IItemFactory`2 itemFactory, IToolsetProvider toolsetProvider, ProjectRootElementCacheBase projectRootElementCache, BuildEventContext buildEventContext, ISdkResolverService sdkResolverService, Int32 submissionId, EvaluationContext evaluationContext, Boolean interactive)
   bei Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.Project.ProjectImpl.Reevaluate(ILoggingService loggingServiceForEvaluation, ProjectLoadSettings loadSettings, EvaluationContext evaluationContext)
   bei Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.Project.ProjectImpl.ReevaluateIfNecessary(ILoggingService loggingServiceForEvaluation, ProjectLoadSettings loadSettings, EvaluationContext evaluationContext)
   bei Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.Project.ProjectImpl.ReevaluateIfNecessary(EvaluationContext evaluationContext)
   bei Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.Project.ProjectImpl.Initialize(IDictionary`2 globalProperties, String toolsVersion, String subToolsetVersion, ProjectLoadSettings loadSettings, EvaluationContext evaluationContext)
   bei Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.Project..ctor(String projectFile, IDictionary`2 globalProperties, String toolsVersion, String subToolsetVersion, ProjectCollection projectCollection, ProjectLoadSettings loadSettings, EvaluationContext evaluationContext)
   bei Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.Project..ctor(String projectFile)
```

### Sample project

[BaseLibrary.zip](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/4568006/BaseLibrary.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Generate nuget.config file from NuGet CLI" (#9539) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe): `NuGet.exe`

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx): `5.5.1.6542`

dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate): `3.1.201`

VS version (if appropriate): `Visual Studio 2019`

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)): `Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.18363.778]`

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: `No.`

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

`N/A`

## Other suggested things

In `npm`, there is a `npm init -y` command that can generate a default `package.json` file.

In `tsc` (TypeScript), there is a `tsc --init` command that can generate a default `tsconfig.json` file.

I think `nuget` (NuGet CLI) should have something like that to generate a default `nuget.config` file.

### Verbose Logs

Please include verbose logs (NuGet.exe <COMMAND> -verbosity detailed | dotnet.exe <COMMAND> --verbosity diag | etc...)

`N/A`

### Sample Project

Very helpful if you can zip a project and paste into this issue!

`N/A`

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug Bash][Test Failure] PM UI can’t show distinguishable background color between selected and hovered package sources" (#9538) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
NuGet version: NuGet Client Dev\5.7.0.6598
VS Version: Master\30029.156
OS: Windows-10-Enterprise-RS5
## Detailed repro steps 
1. Launch VS with any color theme (Blue/Blue (Extra Contrast)/Dark/Light) and create a Console App (.NET Core) template.
2. Open the PM UI, click the arrow-down button of “Package source” drop down list and hover on another source (not the selected).
## Expected
The background color between selected and hovered package sources should be distinguishable.
## Actual
PM UI can’t show distinguishable background color between selected and hovered package sources as below screenshot.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20632625/81134691-19d5fd00-8f88-11ea-9f13-f1237af89dcb.png)
## Notes
1. Move from internal bug 753473.
2. It's not a regression bug because it did repro on D16.0stg\28417.107.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug Bash][Suggestion][Test Failure] Update button in Package Manager Settings window should be focused when selecting by pressing Alt+U" (#9537) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
NuGet version: NuGet Client Dev\5.7.0.6598
VS Version: Master\30029.156
OS: Windows-10-Enterprise-RS5
## Detailed repro steps 
1. Launch VS and click menu "Tools" -> "Nuget Package Manager" -> "Package Manger Settings".
2. Select "Package Sources" in the left pane.
3. Press Alt+U. 
## Expected
Update button should be focused when selecting by pressing Alt+U.
## Actual
Update button in Package Manager Settings window is not focused when selecting by pressing Alt+U as attached screenshot. Users don’t know if it is selected or not.
## Notes
1. Move from internal bug 651997.
2. It's not a regression bug because it did repro on D15.8 27918.00 + NuGet Client Release-4.8.0-RTM 4.8.0.5348.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Test: on macOS, TimestampSignatureAsync_TimestampingCountersignature_SucceedsAsync starts to fail after switching to latest Pkcs package" (#9536) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
On macOS,  test TimestampSignatureAsync_TimestampingCountersignature_SucceedsAsync failed after switching to latest `System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs` package. (version change from 5.0.0-alpha1.19473.1 to 5.0.0-preview.3.20214.6)

Error message:
`NuGet.Packaging.Signing.TimestampException : The timestamp response is invalid. Nonces did not match.`

Stack trace
```
 at NuGet.Packaging.Signing.Rfc3161TimestampProvider.ValidateTimestampResponse(Byte[] nonce, Byte[] messageHash, IRfc3161TimestampToken timestampToken) in /Users/runner/runners/2.166.4/work/1/s/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Packaging/Signing/Timestamp/Rfc3161TimestampProvider.cs:line 211
   at NuGet.Packaging.Signing.Rfc3161TimestampProvider.GetTimestampAsync(TimestampRequest request, ILogger logger, CancellationToken token) in /Users/runner/runners/2.166.4/work/1/s/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Packaging/Signing/Timestamp/Rfc3161TimestampProvider.cs:line 126
   at NuGet.Packaging.Signing.Rfc3161TimestampProvider.TimestampSignatureAsync(PrimarySignature primarySignature, TimestampRequest request, ILogger logger, CancellationToken token) in /Users/runner/runners/2.166.4/work/1/s/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Packaging/Signing/Timestamp/Rfc3161TimestampProvider.cs:line 69
   at NuGet.Packaging.FuncTest.TimestampProviderTests.TimestampSignatureAsync_TimestampingCountersignature_SucceedsAsync() in /Users/runner/runners/2.166.4/work/1/s/test/NuGet.Core.FuncTests/NuGet.Packaging.FuncTest/SigningTests/TimestampProviderTests.cs:line 474
--- End of stack trace from previous location ---
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Deprecating TLS 1.0 and 1.1 on NuGet.org – Stage 1" (#42) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
## NuGet.org will temporarily remove support for TLS 1.0/1.1 on February 26, 2020

We plan to temporarily remove support for TLS 1.0/1.1 across 3 time slots in a 24 hour period, for 4 hours each, to ensure overlap with normal working hours across the globe. If you discover that you are impacted and cannot identify a workaround, please open an issue on the NuGet Gallery GitHub repo.

Read this blog post to learn more and to identify the test slot time in your time zone - https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/deprecating-tls-1-0-and-1-1-on-nuget-org-stage-1/
